title: Finite multiplication of numbers and finite multiplication of functions

blocks.name: fmul01
blocks.content: Multiplying a finite number of values in [ 0 , 1 ] , gives the final product itself a number in [ 0 , 1 ]. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: fmulcl
blocks.content: If ' Y ' is closed under the multiplication of two functions, then Y is closed under the multiplication ( ' X ' ) of a finite number of functions. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: fmuldfeq
blocks.content: X and Z are two equivalent definitions of the finite product of real functions. Y is a set of real functions from a common domain T, Y is closed under function multiplication and U is a finite sequence of functions in Y. M is the number of functions multiplied together. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm fmuldfeq(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s0))))
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c3)
  -| wceq(c4, cmpo(s2, s3, c3, c3, cmpt(s0, c0, co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), cmul, cfv(cv(s3), cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, c5), c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cmpt(s0, c0, cmpt(s1, co(nat1, cfz, c6), cfv(cfv(c5, cv(s1)), cv(s0)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(cseq(nat1, cmul, cfv(c7, cv(s0))), c6)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c5, co(nat1, cfz, c6), c3))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s2), c3)), wf(cv(s2), c0, cr))
  -| wi(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(s2), c3), wcel(cv(s3), c3)), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), cmul, cfv(cv(s3), cv(s0)))), c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)

blocks.name: fmul01lt1lem1
blocks.content: Given a finite multiplication of values betweeen 0 and 1, a value larger than its first element is larger the whole multiplication. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)

blocks.name: fmul01lt1lem2
blocks.content: Given a finite multiplication of values betweeen 0 and 1, a value ` E ` larger than any multiplicand, is larger than the whole multiplication. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)

  syl(w0, wf(c1, c3, c2), wcel(c1, co(c3, ccncf, c2)))
  cncff(c1, c3, c2)
  a1i(w0, wceq(cmpt(s0, c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cmpt(hs0, c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))))
  cbvmpt(s0, hs0, c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))
  nffv(hs0, c1, cv(s0))
  nfcv(hs0, c1)
  nfcv(hs0, cv(s0))
  nffv(s0, c1, cv(hs0))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs0))
  fveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c1)
  sylc(w0, wcel(cres(c1, c0), co(c0, ccncf, c2)), wss(c0, c3), wcel(c1, co(c3, ccncf, c2)))
  rescncf(c0, c3, c1, c2)

  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1 ` s0))∈(c0[-cn->]c2))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈(c3[-cn->]c2))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ⊆ c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd((s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1 ` s0)), (c0[-cn->]c2), (c1 |` c0), w0)
  3eqtr4rd((s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1 ` s0)), (c1 |` c0), ((hs0 ∈ c3 ↦(c1 ` hs0))|` c0), (hs0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1 ` hs0)), w0)
  resmptd(hs0, c3, (c1 ` hs0), c0, w0)

  feqmptd(hs0, c1, c3, c2, w0)
  syl(w0, (c1 : c3 → c2), c1 ∈(c3[-cn->]c2))
  cncff(c1, c3, c2)
  a1i(w0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1 ` s0))=(hs0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1 ` hs0)))
  cbvmpt(s0, hs0, c0, (c1 ` s0), (c1 ` hs0))
  nffv(hs0, c1, s0)
  nfcv(hs0, c1)
  nfcv(hs0, s0)
  nffv(s0, c1, hs0)
  nfcv(s0, hs0)
  fveq2(s0, hs0, c1)
  sylc(w0, (c1 |` c0)∈(c0[-cn->]c2), c0 ⊆ c3, c1 ∈(c3[-cn->]c2))
  rescncf(c0, c3, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

}

  eqeltrrd((s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1[×](c2 ` s0))), (c0[-cn->]ℂ), ((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0))∘ c2), w0)
  eqtrd(((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0))∘ c2), (s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1[×](c2 ` s0))), (hs0 ∈ c0 ↦((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0))`(c2 ` hs0))), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, ((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0))∘ c2)=(hs0 ∈ c0 ↦((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0))`(c2 ` hs0))), ((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0)): ℂ → ℂ), (c2 : c0 → ℂ))

  cncff((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0)), cc, cc)
  fcompt(hs0, (s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0)), cc, cc, c2, c0)
  syl6eq((hs0 ∈ c0 ↦((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0))`(c2 ` hs0))), (s0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1[×](c2 ` s0))), (hs0 ∈ c0 ↦(c1[×](c2 ` hs0))), w0)
  mpteq2dva(hs0, c0, ((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(c1[×]s0))`(c2 ` hs0)), (c1[×](c2 ` hs0)), w0)

  oveq2(s0, (c2 ` hs0), c1, cmul)
  cbvmpt(hs0, s0, c0, (c1[×](c2 ` hs0)), (c1[×](c2 ` s0)))
  nfov(s0, c1, cmul, (c2 ` hs0))
  nfcv(s0, c1)

blocks.content: The infimum of a nonempty bounded set of reals is the greatest lower bound. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Sep-2020.)

thm infrglb(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wcel(c1, cr)), wb(wbr(cinf(c0, cr, clt), clt, c1), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s2), clt, c1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  infglbb(s2, s0, s1, c1, cr, c0, clt, w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))))
  a1i(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wor(clt, cr))

  infm3(s0, s1, s2, c0)
  simp1(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))
  diff.clt.s(s2)
  diff.cr.s(s0)
  diff.clt.s(s0)
  diff.cr.s(s1)
  diff.clt.s(s1)
  diff.w3a.s(s2, wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))
  diff.wss.s(s2, c0, cr)
  diff.wne.s(s2, c0, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s2)
  diff.wrex.s(s2, s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))

  eqtr4d(cmpt(s0, c0, co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cexp, c2)), ccom(cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cexp, c2)), c1), cmpt(hs0, c0, cfv(cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cexp, c2)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), w0)

thm expcnfg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦((c1 ` s0)[^]c2))∈(c0[-cn->]ℂ))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈(c0[-cn->]ℂ))

blocks.name: prodeq2ad
blocks.content: Equality deduction for product. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)

blocks.name: fprodsplit1
blocks.content: Separate out a term in a finite product. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm fprodsplit1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cprod(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, cmul, cprod(s0, cdif(c0, csn(c3)), c1))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c0))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)), wceq(c1, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  fprodsplit1f(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  nfcvd(s0, c2, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fprodsplit1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → prod(s0 ∈ c0, c1)=(c2[×]prod(s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 }), c1)))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ Fin)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 = c3)→ c1 = c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  fprodsplit1f(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  nfcvd(s0, c2, w0)
}

blocks.name: fprod0
blocks.content: A finite product with a zero term is zero. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)

thm fprod0(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cprod(s0, c0, c1), nat0))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c3), wceq(c1, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, nat0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  3eqtrd(cprod(s0, c0, c1), nat0, co(c2, cmul, cprod(s0, cdif(c0, csn(c3)), c1)), co(nat0, cmul, cprod(s0, cdif(c0, csn(c3)), c1)), w0)
  fprodsplit1f(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, wnfc(s0, c2))
  adantl(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c3), wceq(c1, c2))
  oveq1d(c2, cmul, cprod(s0, cdif(c0, csn(c3)), c1), nat0, w0)
  mul02d(cprod(s0, cdif(c0, csn(c3)), c1), w0)
  fprodclf(s0, cdif(c0, csn(c3)), c1, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c3)), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))
  diffi(c0, csn(c3))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cdif(c0, csn(c3)))), wcel(c1, cc), w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  simpl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cdif(c0, csn(c3))))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cdif(c0, csn(c3))), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  eldifi(cv(s0), c0, csn(c3))
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c0, csn(c3))
  diff.csn.s(s0, c3)

thm fprod0(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → prod(s0 ∈ c0, c1)= 0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ Fin)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ (s0 = c3 → c1 = c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 = 0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  3eqtrd(prod(s0 ∈ c0, c1), nat0, (c2[×]prod(s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 }), c1)), (0[×]prod(s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 }), c1)), w0)
  fprodsplit1f(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, F/(s0, c2))
  adantl(w0, s0 = c3, c1 = c2)
  oveq1d(c2, cmul, prod(s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 }), c1), nat0, w0)
  mul02d(prod(s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 }), c1), w0)
  fprodclf(s0, (c0 \ { c3 }), c1, w0)
  syl(w0, (c0 \ { c3 })∈ Fin, c0 ∈ Fin)
  diffi(c0, { c3 })
  syl2anc((w0 ∧ s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 })), c1 ∈ ℂ, w0, s0 ∈ c0)
  simpl(w0, s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 }))
  adantl(w0, s0 ∈(c0 \ { c3 }), s0 ∈ c0)
  eldifi(s0, c0, { c3 })
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c0, { c3 })
  diff.csn.s(s0, c3)
}

blocks.name: mccl
blocks.content: A multinomial coefficient, in its standard domain, is a positive integer. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)

blocks.name: fprodcnlem
blocks.content: A finite product of functions to complex numbers from a common topological space is continuous. Induction step. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm fprodcnlem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cprod(s1, cun(c1, csn(c2)), c3)), co(c4, ccn, c5)))
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfv(ctopon, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cfn))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c6)), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c3), co(c4, ccn, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cdif(c6, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cprod(s1, c1, c3)), co(c4, ccn, c5)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(cmpt(s0, c0, cprod(s1, cun(c1, csn(c2)), c3)), co(c4, ccn, c5), cmpt(s0, c0, co(cprod(s1, c1, c3), cmul, csb(s1, c2, c3))), w0)
  mpteq2dva(s0, c0, cprod(s1, cun(c1, csn(c2)), c3), co(cprod(s1, c1, c3), cmul, csb(s1, c2, c3)), w0)

  eldifad(c2, c6, c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c2, cdif(c6, c1)))
  mpcom(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, c6)), wcel(csb(s1, c2, c3), cc), wcel(c2, c6))
  simpr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, c6))
  vtoclgf(s1, c2, c6, wi(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, c6)), wcel(csb(s1, c2, c3), cc)), wi(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cv(s1), c6)), wcel(c3, cc)))

  nfan(s1, w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  nfv(s1, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  nfel1(s1, csb(s1, c2, c3), cc)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s1), c2), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cv(s1), c6)), wcel(c3, cc), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, c6)), wcel(csb(s1, c2, c3), cc))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(s1), c2), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cv(s1), c6), wcel(c2, c6))

  syl3anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c6)), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, c3), c0, cc), wcel(c4, cfv(ctopon, c0)), wcel(c5, cfv(ctopon, cc)), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c3), co(c4, ccn, c5)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c6), wcel(c4, cfv(ctopon, c0)))
  a1i(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c6)), wcel(c5, cfv(ctopon, cc)))

blocks.name: fprodcn
blocks.content: A finite product of functions to complex numbers from a common topological space is continuous. The class expression for ` B ` normally contains free variables ` k ` and ` x ` to index it. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
